VAT £ inc.VAT Options Colour: Black Back Panel White Back Panel Clear Back Panel Clear Frost Back Panel Coloured Back Panel 2: 2: Qty Add to basket Get a quote Staff Photo Notice Boards - Perspex Acrylic Staff photo notice boards, or "Meet The Team" boards are a perfect way of letting people know who's who in a school, NHS Wards, general office and commercial workplace, recreation centres, reception areas, etc. Each clear pocket allows a small photo of a relevent member of staff. Options available include: choice of back acrylic colour, the number of photo pockets. We also offer a secure, tamper proof version, please click here for further details. NEW! We can now offer staff boards with your name and logo printed directlty to the top of the display - call for details. Features and Benefits: Please double click on the above images of our acrylic staff photo boards to zoom into a more detailed view Staff photo boards provide a professioal looking wall mounted display panel for quick reference of staff / team members Choice of black, white, clear or clear frost 5mm thick acrylic back panel with polished edges. Corners are rounded with no sharp edges Clear acrylic photo pockets allow staff photos to be changed quickly and easily Supplied with 4 polished sign fittings to give that floating effect off a wall Each photo pocket size is 75mm high x 50mm wide Header panel pocket is 260mm wide x 50mm high Please see the table below for our standard sized staff photo boards. We also manufacture custom sized boards if you require different sized pockets or different quantities of pockets - please call us on 01202 480104 for further details. Staff photo board prices are detailed in the drop down menu at the top of the page. Manufactured to order in our factory in Christchurch, Dorset, UK. Please allow 5 working days for delivery Please see our stand off fittings instructions by clicking here Looking for a a more secure staff photo board which can't be tampered with? Check out our Secure Staff Photo Boards ! Looking for a staff photo board with a different coloured back panel? We have a range of colours available other than our standard colours listed! Please contact us for a quote. Looking for a staff photo board with bespoke printing and branding to suit your business? With state of the art printers, we are able to fully print or brand these staff boards with your logos and messages! If this is something you are interested in, contact us for a quote! Digital Personnel File [child] [en] With the digital personnel file, you always have an overview of your employees' data Absences [child] [en] Organize your absences clearly and quickly Feedback & Performance [child] [en] Actively promote the personal development of your employees through constructive feedback Learning [child] [en] Plan the development of your employees Time Tracking [child] [en] Streamline HR Time Tracking Payroll [child] [en] The module for wages and salaries gives you a good overview for the next payroll. HR Insights [en] Company [has_children] [en] About Us [child] [en] Partners [child] [en] Career [child] [en] FAQ [child] [en] Contact [en] Login [en] DE EN ONLINE DEMO BUCHEN Die HR Software für Unternehmensgestalter Ihr Copilot im HR Team Mit staffboard gestalten Sie Ihr Personalwesen nach den Bedürfnissen Ihrer Organisation. Sie schaffen mehr Zeit und Transparenz für Ihr Team, in einer modernen HR Software. JETZT KOSTENLOS TESTEN Good Bye, Papier Chaos! Herzlich Willkommen, Digitale Personalakte! Mit Hilfe der digitalen Mitarbeiterverwaltung können Sie alle Informationen über Ihre Mitarbeiter übersichtlich an einem Ort abspeichern. Suchen Sie mühsam nach Arbeitsverträgen, Attesten oder sonstigen Mitarbeiterdokumenten und verlieren dadurch wertvolle Zeit? Mit unserer Digitalen Personalakte finden Sie alles auf einen Blick im Mitarbeiterprofil. Dank des Employee Self Service (ESS) können zahlreiche Daten eigenständig von den Mitarbeitern gepflegt werden. So sparen Sie Zeit, Geld und natürlich Nerven für andere wichtige Themen. Bewerbermanagement leicht gemacht Mit unserem übersichtlichen Recruiting Modul verlieren Sie nie mehr einen Bewerber aus den Augen. Durch intuitives Drag & Drop können Sie ihre Bewerber schnell durch die Phasen Ihres individuellen Bewerbungsprozesses leiten. Eingangsbestätigungen werden automatisiert versendet und personalisierte Terminvereinbarungen oder Absagen sind mit einem Klick möglich. Viele Funktionen wie das Abgeben von Bewertungen für Bewerber, schreiben von Kommentaren und die Einbindung weiterer Teammitglieder sind problemlos möglich. STAFFBOARD 30 TAGE KOSTENLOS TESTEN! JETZT ANMELDEN Eine kleine Auswahl unserer treuen Kunden. "Wir sind an dem Punkt, an dem wir ohne dieses Tool schlicht nicht arbeiten könnten." Jakob Schoroth (Reparando GmbH) Managing Director ✔️ staffboard wurde in Deutschland gegründet und hat seinen Hauptsitz in München. ✔️ Die Daten werden ausschließlich in Deutschland verarbeitet und verschlüsselt gespeichert. ✔️ Regelmäßige Updates und Backups sorgen für größtmögliche Sicherheit. Zudem liegen ISO-Zertifizierungen der Hosting Provider vor. ✔️ Die staffboard HR Software und die Daten werden in Rechenzentren in Deutschland gehostet. ✔️ Unternehmen mit dem Siegel hinterlegen beim BITMi e.V. den Standard ihrer Maßnahmen bzgl. Datenschutz. ✔️ Für den Vertrag mit den Hosting Provider gilt ausschließlich deutsches Recht, insbesondere das deutsche Datenschutzrecht, das BGB und das HGB. ✔️ Wir unterliegen der Kontrolle eines externen und unabhängigen Datenschutzbeauftragten. ✔️ Eine AV-Vereinbarung mit jedem Kunden gewährleistet Datenschutz und Datensicherheit. ✔️ Unsere Mitarbeiter sind im Umgang mit sensiblen, personenbezogenen Daten geschult und erhalten regelmäßige Unterweisungen. ✔️ 100% Service: Bei Fragen zum Produkt finden Sie stets einen deutschsprachigen Ansprechpartner. ✔️ 100% Qualität: Die in Deutschland designte staffboard HR Software wird auch in Deutschland getestet. ✔️ 100% Zukunft: Die staffboard HR Software ist investitionssicher und wird kontinuierlich weiterentwickelt und aktualisiert. Melden Sie sich für unseren Newsletter an, um regelmäßig über neue Funktionen und Produkt Updates informiert zu werden. Registrien Email sent! Check your inbox to complete your signup. Digitalisieren Sie Ihre HR Prozesse Unsere staffboard HR Software automatisiert und vereinfacht alle wesentlichen Personalprozesse. Dashboard Recruiting (ATS) Digitale Personalakte Abwesenheitsmanagement Feedback & Performance Learning Zeiterfassung Lohnabrechnung Organigramm Reports Kostenlos & unverbindlich Tage testen * Ich akzeptiere die Datenschutzbestimmungen und die AGB . Jetzt anmelden Benutzerfreundlich Unser intuitives Design ermöglicht eine steile Lernkurve ohne große Einarbeitung. Flexibel Jedes Unternehmen ist anders – und das wissen wir. Darum lässt sich staffboard an Ihre Anforderungen anpassen. Online Greifen Sie von überall mit einer verschlüsselten Verbindung auf staffboard zu. SUPPORT Allgemeine Fragen zum Produkt? 089 - 1250 1458 contact@staffboard.de Für technischen Support innerhalb der Software steht Ihnen ein Ticketsystem zur Verfügung. UNTERSTÜTZER & PARTNER Karriere [de] Impressum [de] Datenschutz [de] AGB [de] Career [en] Imprint [en] Privacy Policy [en] Terms & Conditions [en] 2025 © staffboard | Ihr Copilot im HR Team

Staff and Board – Rooftop Films Our Impact Support Us Donate / Memberships 2025 Sponsorships Rooftop Merch A/V Rentals For Filmmakers Submit a Film for 2025 The Rooftop Filmmakers Fund About Jobs & Volunteer Opportunities Press Meet The Team Schedule Follow Instagram X/Twitter Facebook Newsletter Staff and Board STAFF Kate Gellene, Head of Operations Kate (she/her) joined the Rooftop Films team as an intern in the fall of 2011 and wore many hats before heading the operations department in 2014—including event management, fundraising & membership, and social media. Born and raised in New Jersey, Kate studied Cinema Studies with a minor in French at NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts. During the summer, Kate can (occasionally) be found making your drink at the after-party. Or at the beach. Saidah Russell, Head of Programming Saidah (she/her) joined the Rooftop Films team in 2022 and previously worked full time in film exhibition at an arthouse theater in Westchester, NY. She has experience working on screening committees for several festivals, including the Sundance Film Festival, Hamptons International Film Festival, and Indie Memphis Film Festival. She is the Director of Programming for the TIDE Film Festival, an emerging Brooklyn-based festival dedicated to showcasing work by filmmakers of color. Kristen Kelley Rand, Head of Marketing and Communications Originally from just north of Boston, Kristen (she/her) is an actress and writer who earned her bachelor’s at New York University’s Gallatin School, where—pursuing as well-rounded an arts education possible—she designed her own interdisciplinary program marrying the studies of performance, production, and marcom. She came to Rooftop following tenure at Universal Pictures, W Magazine, and inside the halls of the McKittrick Hotel with Punchdrunk’s Sleep No More . She credits her maternal gram (and Julia Roberts) with helping shape her into the rom-com savant she is today, and firmly believes you should eliminate the term “guilty pleasure” from your vocabulary if you haven’t already. Langston Sanchez, Head of Technical Operations Langston (he/him) is a media technician and event producer who strives to combine a DIY ethos with seamless production to create high-quality, accessible events in his native New York City. After graduating from Hampshire College with a B.A. in Film and Video Art, Langston’s work has spanned both production and media education, with experience at institutions such as the Cooper Union, Apollo Theater, DOC NYC, Maysles Documentary Center, and the Sundance Film Festival. When not working alongside his team, Langston attempts to strike a balance between chronically online and blissfully unaware. Isabella Jackson, Programmer Isabella (she/her) is a writer and dancer from a tiny town in Pennsylvania. She came to New York to study Dance and Film at The New School, and went on to get her MFA in Screenwriting from Brooklyn College. She’s passionate about independent filmmaking, having worked in and around the industry since 2014 with IFP, The Hamptons International Film Festival, Montclair Film Festival, NewFest, and DOCNYC. Outside of festivals, she works in TV as a Writer’s Assistant and Script Coordinator. In the world, you can find her listening to disco, writing strange stories, or watching a campy horror flick. Hilina Kidane, Programmer Hilina (she/her) began with Rooftop Films as Volunteer Coordinator before joining the programming team. She’s worked across a number of film festivals and is currently full-time at the New York International Children’s Film Festival, where she supports youth-enrichment programs. Darby Puckett, Programmer Darby (she/her) is an actress and filmmaker from Virginia Beach, VA. She started at Rooftop as an intern, and that’s when the addiction to watching short films began. Aside from film watching, she’s usually training for a random half marathon, memorizing lines, or dream-casting Broadway musicals. Mariales Diaz, Programming Assistant Mariales Diaz (they/them) is a gender-expansive Dominican writer, director, producer, and programmer living in New York. Their storytelling explores experiences that exist at the intersection of survival and love. Diaz has worked on the production and post-archival teams at companies such as Pilgrim Media Group, Religion of Sports, HBO Max, and Proximity Media. They are a graduate of the SUNY Purchase Film Conservatory and a 2024 Sundance Institute Trans Possibilities Fellow. They also have participated in fellowships and artist programs such as Film at Lincoln Center’s Artist Academy, Sundance Ignite, Creative Culture at The Jacob Burns Film Center, and NeXt Doc. C. “Meaks” Meaker, Venue Manager Meaks (they/them) is a writer whose work often explores queerness, monstrosity, and the end of the world. Their plays have been performed and developed across the United States, including the Kennedy Center, Seattle Repertory Theatre, San Francisco Playhouse, Annex Theatre in Seattle, and About Face in Chicago. They are a Stranger Award Genius Nominee and Gregory Award Outstanding New Play Nominee. They are a former Jerome Fellow at the Playwrights’ Center, an alumna of Seattle Repertory Theatre’s Writers Group, and former Walter E. Dakin Fellow at Sewanee Writers’ Conference. Their essay “S(wallow)” won the Editor’s Prize at Porter House Review and they were a Creative Nonfiction Fellow at Lambda Literary. They received an MFA in Playwriting from University of Iowa’s Playwrights Workshop. When they’re not managing venues for Rooftop, they teach writing at City College of New York. Madeline Chandler, Volunteer and Local Partnerships Coordinator Madeline (she/her) does not stop talking about being from Pittsburgh, doing her undergrad at Penn State, and doing her post-grad degrees at the University of Glasgow in Scotland. If you ever want to talk about coffee, hippos or other round animals, ice breakers, or why teen movies are misunderstood, Madeline’s your girl! Tess Meersman, Festival Assistant Tess (she/her) is a filmmaker and artist who began working for Rooftop Films in 2024 after graduating from Emerson College with a degree in Film Production and double minor in Gender & Sexuality Studies and Literature. Her work has been featured in the GRRL HAUS Cinema screening series, Revolutions per Minute festival, Huret & Spector Gallery, Karen Aqua Gallery, and the Gravitational Lensing film series. When not at work, you can find her rewatching The X Files or making a collage with her beautiful cat, Hitch. BOARD OF DIRECTORS Mark Elijah Rosenberg, Chair Filmmaker, Founder and Former Artistic Director of Rooftop Films Sara Christoph, Vice Chair Business Development Manager, Morgan Stanley Ryan Smith, Treasurer Managing Director, Piper Sandler Camille Bernier-Green Head of Development, A Touch More Jamie Dennison Hayden Goldblatt Jess Jacobs Kay-B Entertainment Journalist/Critic/Producer/Host Adam Kersh Co-Founder, Fusion Management Eric Kohn Evan List Vice President & Client Advisor, Bernstein Global Wealth Management Rachel Meierovich Molly Thompson Join Our Newsletter Get early access to screenings & more Rooftop Films 232 3rd St. Suite E-106 Brooklyn, NY 11215 info@rooftopfilms.com 718-417-7362 A/V Equipment Rentals rentals@rooftopfilms.com 347-725-3874 Start Your Rental Request Follow Rooftop Films Instagram @rooftopfilms X/Twitter @rooftopfilms Facebook @rooftopfilmsinc Newsletter © 2025 Rooftop Films Term of Use Privacy We use cookies to improve your experience. By continuing to use our site, you accept our use of cookies. OK

Privacy Terms & Conditions Terms of Use Overview Spaces Press Nearby Hotels Nubé Rooftop Restaurant 505 N Fort Lauderdale Beach Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304, USA Nubé Rooftop 505 N Fort Lauderdale Beach Blvd, Fort Lauderdale, FL 33304, USA Visit Website View Phone Number Instagram Cuisine Type Cocktail Bar # of Spaces 1 Capacity Max Seated: 240 Where the sky's embrace meets ocean's gaze, atop the 26th floor of Hilton Fort Lauderdale Beach Resort, Nubé offers panoramic views and an innovative menu inspired by its surroundings. The atmosphere seamlessly blends lounge vibes with elevated dining, creating a unique 'lounge-aurant' experience. Our rooftop provides both indoor and outdoor seating options, featuring a wraparound glass balcony and walls that vanish into the breathtaking ocean views.

As sunset hues fade to starry nights, sit seaside on the sky terrace, enjoy an intimate setting at the Solstice Bar and Lounge, and embrace the sky-high energy at the Lunar Bar, where the outside melds seamlessly with the inside. Our whimsical menu of crafted cocktails reflects a coastal flair, accompanied by chef-curated shareable plates that embody a blend of luxury and approachability, offering a Contemporary American & South Florida Coastal dining experience. Floating on top of Hilton Fort Lauderdale Beach Resort in Central Beach, NubÃ© is the only oceanfront rooftop in Fort Lauderdale. 26 floor above it all, where the sky meets the ocean, the stylish and modern rooftop seamlessly melds indoor and outdoor seating options, featuring a wraparound glass balcony and walls that vanish into breathtaking views over the ocean and skyline. Inspired by its surroundings, the NubÃ© menu features a whimsical selection of crafted cocktails that reflects a coastal flair, as well as a fine array of wines, accompanied by chef-curated shareable plates that embody a blend of luxury and approachability, offering a Contemporary American & South Florida Coastal dining experience. Blending lounge vibes with elevated dining to create a unique 'lounge-aurant' experience, you can visit for intimate bites and drinks on the sky terrace and watch as sunset hues fade to starry nights, or embrace the sky-high energy inside. Our Business Housing associations (also called Registered Providers) are governed by their ârulesâ which define our not-for-profit objectives, shareholding membership and constitute the Board as our governing body. Board members have a wide range of skills and experience reflecting the services we provide, our customers and the size and financial complexity and strength of the business. Each association has a Board but the members combine their functions through a single governance meeting that is held six times during the year. In addition, the board members attend regular seminars, business planning and formal events. The Boards are committed to high standards of corporate governance and have adopted the National Housing Federationâs âCode of Governance' and good practice guidance. Meet the executive team Boris Worrall Group Chief Executive Read more Boris Worrall Group Chief Executive Boris is Group Chief Executive of Rooftop Housing, which provides almost 7,000 affordable homes in Worcestershire and Gloucestershire. Boris has been involved in housing for 15 years and is a regular blogger on policy, politics and business transformation. He began his career as a journalist before working for the Home Office. Boris is responsible for: Building strong working relationships with internal and external stakeholders to ensure the delivery of the highest possible standard of service to our tenants and other customers. Maintaining high standards of probity and develop an open and honest culture in line with the Groupâs Values, codes of governance, Colleague Code of Conduct and Probity Policy. Leading a strong, distinctive performance culture and commitment to service excellence with a focus on enhancing customer experience through the âmaking a differenceâ ways of working. Fostering an environment where the views of residents are integral to service development and where best practice is routinely identified, shared and implemented. Ensuring strong relationships with resident groups, representatives, and advocates to provide assurance that the community ethos of the organisation is championed. Ensuring that value for money is demonstrated in all aspects of service delivery and provide information to the Board to enable them to monitor this. Representing Rooftop as required, acting as an ambassador to enhance recognition as the pre-eminent provider of excellent housing and related services across the region. In conjunction with the Chair, ensure the governance of the organisation is effective and members are developed and supported to fulfil their roles. Provide appropriate and timely information and develop an open and transparent dialogue. Ensure an appropriate control and assurance framework is in place to meet statutory, regulatory and financial requirements in order to manage risks to Rooftop. In his spare time Boris enjoys surfing, yoga and keeping chickens. Mark is responsible for: Developing the strategic priorities and annual business plans for housing management, responsive repairs, income collection, lettings, and supported housing including preparation and control of departmental budgets. Planning and delivering cost effective housing management and support services both to tenants and community customers, delivering a comprehensive range of services to meet needs. Devising, recommending, and implementing an effective and efficient responsive repairs service, that supports high level customer satisfaction meets customer needs and budgetary requirements. Delivering effective, efficient, and timely Voids properties in a reasonable condition so that they are ready to let and meet customer expectations. Corporate responsibility for the resolution, reporting and oversight of complaints management and compliance with the Housing Ombudsmanâs compliant handling code. Â Acting as the âresponsible personâ who will ensure that we are complying with the Consumer Standards. Â Ensuring effective Customer Scrutiny and engagement/influence in service scrutiny and continual improvement. Ensuring the delivery of rent and service charges in line with Statutory and Regulatory requirements and Rooftopâs policy. Ensuring the provision of advice, support, and signposting to support customers and protect Rooftopâs income from rent and service charges. Sam has responsibility for Finance, Human Resources, Governance, Risk and Assurance, Communications, ICT and Performance. Managing negotiations and relationships with the Groupâs funders and seeking to negotiate funding on the most competitive and flexible terms commensurate with risk. Developing and implementing a Data strategy to maximise the use of data based on best practice and remain fully compliant with all data regulation. Developing, implementing and maintaining the People Strategy, that engages and develops individuals and teams, facilitating and enabling high performance and high engagement.
